channel.title: Exp rate
channel.description: How can I make it so that no one follows the same exp rate? What would I do to this: [code]Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 5000;[/code] To make it only apply to a single player For example I want 1 player to get 5000 xp per hit and another to get 500 xp per hit How would I do that?

item.title: Exp rate
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Sparta I Am Sparta
item.description:
@I_Am_Sparta wrote:

The Soul:

Are you extending the Player class then?

Uhm no

item.title: Exp rate
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Sparta I Am Sparta
item.description:
@I_Am_Sparta wrote:

Idk how to do that
Basically I have in the character files. SO its already done in play.java and playersave.java
I have 4 modes:
easyMode
mediumMode
hardMode
extremeMode

And if they are set to true, I want the the exp rate to change for example
easyMode = 5000 exp rate
mediumMode = 500 exp rate
hardMode = 50 exp rate
extremeMode = 10 exp rate

Read full topic

You don’t have a variable named easyMode. And ternary operands don’t exactly work like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Exp rate
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

you probably have an addExperience method somewhere, just use a switch statement like so:

[code=Java]
public void addExperience(Player player, int id, double exp) {
switch(player.getMode()) {
case EASY:
exp *= 5000;
break;

    case MEDIUM:
        exp *= 500;
        break;
 }

}[/code]
Something like that should suffice.

Read full topic
